Careers > Product Manager Last modified a month ago Product Manager Full Time AdaCore NY or Remote USA 10+ years of experience Everything we do at AdaCore is centered around helping developers build the safest, most secure high-integrity software. For 30 years, we've worked with global leaders across avionics, aerospace, defense and other high-integrity industries, building tools and providing services that ease the complex and difficult process of developing high-integrity software. As the need for truly secure and reliable applications expands into industries such as automotive, medical, energy, and IoT, we’re advancing our time-tested technologies to bring expertise and services to help a whole new generation of developers. Our 150 experts worldwide in the US (New York), France (Paris, Toulouse, Grenoble and Vannes), the UK, Estonia and Germany all play a role in developing bleeding-edge technologies to meet the highest grade of software development. Joining AdaCore is about joining a culture of innovation, openness, collaboration and dependability, which defines how we work together, with our customers, and with our partners. AdaCore is looking for a Product Manager who is ready to work with our international sales, marketing, and Rust product teams and take GNAT Pro for Rust, our Rust offering, to the next level. Your Responsibilities Include Driving GNAT Pro for Rust forward by identifying capabilities that will enable us to meet customer needs, stand out in the marketplace, and enter new industrial domains related to our core strategyAdvocating for Rust within our user base to people currently using C/C++Identifying new potential opportunities in relevant industrial domainsCommunicating daily with other members of the product-management team, sales, engineering, and marketing to ensure product goals are realizedLearning and becoming passionate about RustBuilding ties to and advocating for AdaCore within the Rust community Your Qualification And Skills Must Include Master in computer science or equivalentPrior experience as software engineer10+ years of experience in the software industry3+ years of experience in Product ManagementExcellent communication skillsConfidence working with stakeholders, including executives, across the company to push GNAT Pro for Rust forwardDemonstrated ability to work in a cross-functional team The following are not mandatory but are considered a plus Knowledge of Rust;Strong connections to the Rust community;Knowledge of other high-integrity programming languages such as Ada and C/C++Comfortable with a Unix development environment (git/svn, shell, etc.);Experience using the Python programming language in a production environment; Beyond the job We're a global organization driven by diverse backgrounds, fostering innovation through an open exchange of ideas. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, celebrating diversity in ethnicity, nationality, gender, age, religion, abilities, sexual orientation, veteran or marital status. Our commitment is to help our teammates, wherever they are based, feel comfortable and satisfied, by encouraging flexibility to ensure them a healthy work-life balance. Additionally, we prioritize individual development by offering continuous training from day one with a personalized onboarding plan.

At Vanta, our mission is to secure the internet and protect consumer data. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. As a Senior Product Design Manager, at Vanta, you’ll lead a growing design team that’s responsible for maturing our Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) product, including redesigning existing products and launching new products. Vanta’s design team is warm, collaborative, talented, and ambitious. We love digging into user needs, sorting out complex problems, and designing solutions that help the whole Vanta product work better together. You will thrive at Vanta if you are passionate about building both teams and products, and if you embrace ambiguity, complexity, and the autonomy to shape our experience strategy and how we work as a team. We expect you to play an integral role as a thought leader, shaping our design practice as we continue to scale rapidly. What you’ll do as a Senior Design Manager at Vanta: You will be responsible for managing and growing a team of designers working across multiple EPD squads. Your focus will be bringing new capabilities to the Vanta platform that help us better meet the needs of a wide range of customers: from small startups who value speed, to large companies with complex requirements. Ensure that our efforts across multiple teams fit together to form a coherent product, from design system details, to workflows, all the way up to mental models. Coach and mentor a growing team of Product Designers, providing the expertise, direction, and support needed for high performance.Build a best-in-class team, maintaining high standards for customer experience, design quality, and team cohesion.Establish strong partnerships with Product and Engineering teams, fostering a sense of joint ownership and effective collaboration, and work cross-functional with partners in GTM.Contribute to the product strategy and roadmap, working with Engineering and Product partners, and create the design vision for your domain, aligning it with our business strategy, advocating for customer outcomes and world-class user experience. How to be successful in this role: Have 10+ years of product design experience, with deep experience working on complex B2B and B2C SaaS products and 3+ years of successfully building and managing design teams.Evidence of getting into the details to uphold a high standard of B2B design quality (UX and UI) and craftsmanship in your team’s work.Proven track record of producing designs that impact the business – by digging in yourself, leading through others, and influencing internal stakeholders.Deep experience partnering well with product management and engineering counterparts.Passion for leading, coaching, and building an inspired team through setting vision, unlocking potential, and driving compassionate accountability. Ability to establish a vibrant, opinionated, and inclusive design culture. Deep curiosity about AI and cybersecurity. Prior experience in security is helpful but not required. We’ve found that leaders with strong design skills in technically complex areas can bring fresh perspectives to create great experiences for our users.As part of the interview, we require a portfolio that demonstrates work produced by your teams that has impacted the business, and operational practices you have implemented which have led to a higher functioning team. What you can expect as a Vantan: Industry-competitive compensation100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parentsHealth & wellness and remote workplace stipendsFamily planning benefits through Carrot Fertility401(k) matchingFlexible work hours and locationOpen PTO policy11 paid holidays in the USOffices in SF, NYC, Dublin, and Sydney To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including candidate location, skills, depth of work experience, and relevant licenses/credentials, and may vary from the amounts listed below. At Vanta, we are committed to hiring diverse talent of different backgrounds and as such, it is important to us to provide an inclusive work environment for all. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender identity, age, religion, sexual orientation, veteran or disability status, or any other protected class. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage and welcome people of all backgrounds to apply. About Vanta We started in 2018, in the wake of several high-profile data breaches. Online security was only becoming more important, but we knew firsthand how hard it could be for fast-growing companies to invest the time and manpower it takes to build a solid security foundation. Vanta was inspired by a vision to restore trust in internet businesses by enabling companies to improve and prove their security.From our early days automating security monitoring for compliance standards like SOC 2, HIPAA and ISO 27001 to creating the world's leading Trust Management Platform, our vision remains unchanged. Now more than ever, making security continuous—not just a point-in-time check— is essential. Thousands of companies rely on Vanta to build, maintain and demonstrate their trust— all in a way that's real-time and transparent.

Description K2United is seeking a Product Manager to join our Product Design team. Our ideal candidate understands both the design and development aspects of product development and has a knack for visualizing solutions to create customer value. Requirements About You You’re a technically capable strategic thinker who enjoys collaborative solutioning. Discernment is your superpower, and you excel at identifying the optimal balance between speed and quality. You have an extraordinary capacity for using product knowledge and an understanding of the problem being solved to prioritize impactful work and make reasonable tradeoffs. At a minimum, you have: Bachelor's degree 3+ years relevant business experience Strong communication skills Experience with software development lifecycle Familiarity with Jira and creating well-written User Stories Experience working in an Agile environment and using applications like Figma, Miro, and Confluence is a plus. Your Impact In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to act as a liaison between the design and development teams, providing guidance on the balance between design and technical feasibility to ensure solutions meet both business and user needs. We think we’re a pretty extraordinary company to work for, but you don’t have to take our word for it: K2United is a certified Great Place to Work®, and we’ve been named one of the Best Workplaces in Texas™ and Best Workplaces in Technology™ in the U.S. Salary Description $105,000 Benefits We’re invested in the people who make our success possible. These benefits include: Flexible schedules and remote working options Low-cost, comprehensive medical benefits for employees and their families Quarterly Wellness Reimbursement Program Tax-saving and retirement benefits, including 401(k) with matching and medical savings accounts Company-wide incentive program Generous PTO (Paid Time Off) and leave policies, including paid parental leave Continuing education and professional development support Robust employee engagement program, including both in-person and virtual events Applicants must be willing to submit to a drug test, credit check, and background investigation as part of the selection process. The U.S. government restricts access by Foreign Nationals to certain types of technology and technical data. Consequently, this posting is intended only for U.S. citizens. K2United is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or protected Veteran status. This job description is not an exhaustive list of job responsibilities. K2United management reserves the right to change or alter this job description at any time without notice.
